result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeremy Richard Schug was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant to report today March 11, 2016.
-Court grants Huber for work.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Inclusive of costs.
Apply bond on file and balance to be paid through a payment plan.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Jeremy Richard Schug appeared. Case called at 3:42 p.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for a plea and sentencing. ADA Kelly recites recommendations. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 OWI 3rd in 15CF57. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 OWI 3rd in 15CF57. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CF57. ADA Kelly states there is a refusal associated with this case. Requests the refusal be found reasonable and dismissed. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. DE's father makes statement. Court finds refusal reasonable and dismisses.

 Crt orders:

- Impose 60 days jail. Report today. 3 days jail credit. Huber granted for work.

- 24 months drivers license revocation

- 24 month IID

- AODA and follow through

- Restitution in the amount of $52.00 payable to St Croix County Sheriff's Office for blood draw fee

- $1,694.00 fine inclusive of costs. Bond to apply. DE to set up a payment plan. Payment plan to start 30 days after release.
